product_name: J.Cat BeautyClear Eyesurance Anti-Fatigue Cooling Under Eye Balm Shea Butter Extract
summary: SummaryWake up your eyes with J.Cat Beauty's Clear Eyesurance Anti-Fatigue Cooling Under Eye Balm Shea Butter Extract. It preps the skin for smooth makeup application.
details: DetailsBenefitsAnti-aging and hydratingKey IngredientsShea butter extractItem 2564797How To UseApply Eyesurance Anti-Fatigue Cooling Under Eye Balm under the eye area and blend. Apply J.Cat Beauty Staysurance Concealer as usual and blend it out. Can be worn alone or under makeup for flawless finish.Precaution: Be sure that the ingredients are appropriate for your personal use.IngredientsDimethicone (And) Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Paraffin, Hydrogenate Polydecene, Citrus Limon (Lemon) Fruit Extract, Phenoxyethanol, Fragrance, Ethylhexylglycerin, Butyrospermum Parakii (Shea Butter).
how_to_use: Apply Eyesurance Anti-Fatigue Cooling Under Eye Balm under the eye area and blend. Apply J.Cat Beauty Staysurance Concealer as usual and blend it out. Can be worn alone or under makeup for flawless finish.Precaution: Be sure that the ingredients are appropriate for your personal use.

reviews.headline: Too Thick
reviews.comments: It should be creamy to apply, instead thick like Vaseline.

reviews.headline: PLS READ
reviews.comments: This is the worst product ive ever used this make my eyes burn and did not work even the slightest amount DONT BUY

reviews.headline: Great stuff
reviews.comments: Although i dont feel any cooling effects from this, it is really makes under my eyes so smooth and "awake" looking

reviews.headline: RN Approved
reviews.comments: I used to use a similar product by Kopari that was discontinued. I am a very busy RN who needs something to keep in my pocket at work to throw under my eyes and on my lips at times too! So compact and light weight. Although its not as hydrating as the one that I used to use which contained caffeine and coconut oil, this gets the job done. I just added 5 to my cart for my next purchase. Beats carrying around a big clunky tube.

reviews.headline: Wow! Just WOW!
reviews.comments: I was not expecting to really see much of a difference, but the first time I tried it I didn't look as tired. My daughter ever said "You must be in a good mood. ". I asked why she said that. She said you look like you got some sleep. She didn't know.

reviews.headline: not as great as the pink version of this cream, but still ok
reviews.comments: Tried this version, as the pink one was out of stock last time. Not as awesome as the pink version, but still ok, leaves undereye area smooth, but not quite as moisturized as the pink one. Will use this up, but probably not repurchase, unless on sale or I definitely am in need.

reviews.headline: Holy Grail
reviews.comments: I added this product on a whim to get free shipping, but this quickly became a must have product. While it doesnt cool for me, it does work magic under the eyes by making the skin insanely soft, blurs lines, and allowing any concealer blend without effort. Absolute magic!

reviews.headline: cooling and does what is says
reviews.comments: dont use too much. it does work

reviews.headline: you get what you pay for
reviews.comments: this is just okay. it's definitely smoothing, and brightening, but I didn't notice much hydration or cooling at all, which is really what drew me to it in the first place. not sure it would work under makeup because of the texture. I'll probably use it up, but not repurchase.

reviews.headline: Good under eye primer, not drying
reviews.comments:
I don't understand the negative reviews for this product. I use it after I moisturize my face and eye area, and it makes my concealer glide over my under eyes without pulling the skin. My concealer looks more even and less patchy as well. It also helps keep the area from getting dry throughout the day (I have normal to dry skin btw).

It only helps a little with my bags and dark circles, but for the price I'm very happy and will be repurchasing!

reviews.headline: it doesnt do much
reviews.comments: i have tried every single one of these eye creams but they are not really worth it in my opinion

reviews.headline: Works well packaging excellent
reviews.comments: I do use and very much enjoy this balm. It's cooking and smoothing for my mid-30's fine lines under my eyes. I have problems with puffiness and this does help with that. I like that this tiny little compact has its own little mirror! How handy is that for travel? It's come in very handy. Still, I did a cost analysis of this product gram for gram and found it's actually more expensive than the Tula one (which I also have). Do with that what you will as you get 1/7th product and pay 1/5th the cost. So if you only want a tiny amount (and it's a good amount for travel) then paying less at one time might be best especially for the packaging as this is a pot vs a stick format. I hope this helps! I removed one star because it is more expensive gram for gram than a more prestige brand.

reviews.headline: A good under eye moisturizer
reviews.comments: This works well as a moisturizer for my under eye. It doesn't irritate my skin (I have sensitive skin) or make my eyes water.

reviews.headline: Works good!
reviews.comments: I use this daily for the puffiness under my eyes and it works well! I didn't think it would do much but I was wrong.  Good product!

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Love this balm, it's smoothing and definitely helps my concealer. Will buy again!

reviews.headline: great gifting item
reviews.comments: I saw Tati reviewing this item so I wanted to gift this for my mom who has tiny finelines around her eyes. My mom love Tati and she sure does like this product.

I like that this tiny little compact has its own little mirror! How handy is that for travel? It's come in very handy. Still, I did a cost analysis of this product gram for gram and found it's actually more expensive than the Tula one (which I also have). faceoff_positive.headline: Works well packaging excellent

faceoff_negative.comments: this is just okay. it's definitely smoothing, and brightening, but I didn't notice much hydration or cooling at all, which is really what drew me to it in the first place. not sure it would work under makeup because of the texture. I'll probably use it up, but not repurchase.
faceoff_negative.headline: you get what you pay for

rollup.name: Clear Eyesurance Anti-Fatigue Cooling Under Eye Balm Shea Butter Extract
